before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"9df19","text":"Community engagement","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":20}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"81aj5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"85em8","text":"Community meetings should be held with the village elders and/or the entire village. Send advance notice of your intention to discuss the surveillance plan with the village before you travel to the village. The purpose of the meeting is to introduce yourselves and discuss the objective of the work as well as to receive permission to work in the village. Details include where the work will take place, and any advantages or disadvantages associated with the work.During the meeting allow questions to be asked and be sure to address any concerns that the village may have about the proposed work. If collectors are required, they should be recruited from each village when appropriate as this both provides employment and educates the community about mosquitoes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"869qd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a81lk","text":"Ethics approvals","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":16}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3tsug","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8tamh","text":"Ethics approval for surveillance which involves using humans or animals as bait for mosquitoes may need to be obtained before starting any work, particularly if the mosquito collections are being performed for research purposes. Where approvals have been granted by your institution and/or your country’s Ethics Review Board, subsequent collection of mosquito samples must comply with the requirements of the permit.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9rmo6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fv0um","text":"Human ethics","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aq1k","text":"The first priority of any study is the safety, confidentiality and dignity of any participants involved in the surveillance program. Participants must be over 18 years of age and not pregnant. The potential risks and benefits of the study will be discussed verbally in the local language with the aid of a participant information sheet detailing these issues in writing. The participants must provide written informed consent, and acknowledging their understanding that they are free to withdraw consent at any time.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5mrjd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3m6td","text":"Animal ethics","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5kjrj","text":"All activities relating to the care and use of animals for research should be conducted humanely. An animal is defined as any living non-human vertebrate (i.e. fish, amphibians, reptiles, birds and mammals). Where animals are used as lures to attract mosquitoes, the animal should not be unduly stressed, managed by its owner and have access to food and water. Different individual animals should be rotated over sequential nights of sampling to allow rest periods. Animals showing signs of agitation will be immediately released from the study. The owners will need to provide informed consent before the animal can be used. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"4alia","text":"The purpose of this Standard Operating Procedure (SOP) is to outline processes for the surveillance, processing and storage of mosquito samples in the field.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9th4k","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7ar0e","text":"A detailed vector surveillance plan is required to guide mosquito surveillance activities. The purpose and priority for vector surveillance should be outlined; as an example, routine surveillance may be conducted to understand:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1jccn","text":"· Adult vector occurrence, species composition and behaviour ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cmmf6","text":"· Vector insecticide resistance status","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c7mhu","text":"· Immature vector aquatic habitats","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"69mdh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9007k","text":"The work plan should map out the entomological indicators being monitored, timelines, milestones, staff requirements, sampling sites, sampling period, sampling methods, equipment, consumables, insectary maintenance, data management and dissemination, training and administrative requirements. The work plan will need to be fully costed within an approved budget.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cjr34","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5brsb","text":"As mosquito densities can vary greatly within even a limited area, a representative sample of the density of mosquitoes in a given surveillance site (i.e., a village or neighbourhood) requires collection of mosquitoes at multiple sampling stations (e.g., houses) to provide an accurate estimate of adult mosquito densities (Box 1). As an example, a minimum of 6 sampling stations (houses) per surveillance site (village or neighbourhood block) might be used to estimate adult mosquito densities. Depending on the resources available and size of the surveillance site, the number of sampling stations may be higher. This sampling effort is then replicated across multiple surveillance sites.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7v0pr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"adapo","text":"A wide variety of surveillance methods can be used to capture mosquitoes, and for each surveillance method a number of different collection tools may be used. The surveillance methods selected generally depend on the particular life stage and behaviour of the mosquito species being targeted (Silver 2008). Different methods may be employed to target different vector species of medical importance. The work plan will outline the surveillance methods and capture tools chosen for each vector surveillance site.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"fspde","text":"Sampling failure","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":16}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9jqli","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aft32","text":"It’s importantto document whether the sampling effort undertaken was a success or failure so that methods of sampling can be refined if necessary. If the sampling effort was a failure, the reason (if known) should be noted.Possible reasons why sampling efforts fail include:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7h9tn","text":"The mosquito collection apparatus or trap stopped working ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7nqmb","text":"The lure stopped working e.g., a battery-powered fan","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6s1hp","text":"The trap was broken","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b3e7o","text":"The trap had fallen over","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dcmv3","text":"There was a hole in the collection bag or chamber","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"34sdb","text":"The trap was unable to be serviced as the occupant was not home","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"159ld","text":"The samples had been tampered with by an animal or human","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"42jdu","text":"Human error in setting or monitoring traps","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
keywords: Vector surveillance, mosquito, Aedes, Anopheles, Culex,Trapping
materials_text:
{"blocks":[{"key":"6g3ct","text":"Materials for processing mosquitoes include:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":44}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"28c6o","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1vv30","text":"Oral aspirator (1 per collector + spares)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eipjd","text":"White tray","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cedu","text":"Forceps","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3c4n7","text":"Pencil/pen/markers","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ac1ki","text":"Data collection form/digital device","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"17c8r","text":"Dissecting microscope ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"78ouk","text":"Petri dishes","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"97uac","text":"Chloroform (optional)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7e58g","text":"Cotton wool","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4up2l","text":"Freezer (optional)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8l671","text":"Mosquito cage (optional)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bl02a","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6s0nd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"et27s","text":"Materials for storing adult mosquitoes include:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":47}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9qab3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5qbkn","text":"Forceps
Ethanol (optional)
Silica gel (optional)
Labels
Microcentrifuge tubes
Microcentrifuge tube storage boxes
Data collection forms/digital device","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it’s working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"e509g","text":"Preparation for vector surveillance activities","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":46}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e8b2h","text":"· Develop vector surveillance work plan, with required standard operating protocols.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8g9es","text":"· Secure the require funding.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c3q5","text":"· Gain required research or ethical approvals.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8903n","text":"· Perform a stock-take and then order required equipment and consumables. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d5bea","text":"· Plan for data capture.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"afet5","text":"Logistics","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dmc28","text":"· Send advance notice of your arrival to the village.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"85ad8","text":"· Travel to the village that has been selected for the survey. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7spkr","text":"· Hold community meetings.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"54su0","text":"Sampling processes","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":18}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9eu50","text":"· During each sampling period, capture mosquitoes as outlined in the work plan.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"up99","text":"· Process the mosquito samples captured. This may involve killing, sorting and identifying the mosquitoes to species and sex. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2ujo3","text":"· When necessary, store the mosquito samples. Ensure all samples are appropriately stored and labelled. Make sure all tubes, boxes and bags are SEALED carefully.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":144,"length":16}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9qf70","text":"· Record the data, including details about the sampling design and the number of mosquitoes that were captured (by species and sex). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a59h","text":"· Every time you leave a village, pack up your workstation and ensure no rubbish is left in the village. Thank the community before leaving. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ahd97","text":"Mosquitoes are to be captured with the sampling tools described in the work plan. There are some essential pieces of equipment that can be used alongside many sampling tools: namely oral aspirators and collection cups, described below.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8bki4","text":"Oral aspirators","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":15}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5317l","text":"Using an oral aspirator. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8bd87","text":"· With the mouthpiece in your mouth, hold the aspirator tube with its opening 1-2 cm away from the mosquito. Move the end of the aspirator tube closer to the mosquito and, at the same time, suck gently but quickly to pull the mosquito into the aspirator tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b84gk","text":"· Place your finger over the tube to prevent the mosquito from escaping but do not let the mosquito bite.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2o7qs","text":"· Transfer the mosquitoes from the aspirator to the cup. Place the end of the tube, with your finger still in position, near the hole in the mesh covering the paper collection cup. Pull the cotton ball out of the hole in the middle of the cup. Remove your finger from the tube and quickly put the tube into the hole in the netting over the top of the collection cup. Blow gently into the mouthpiece so as to transfer the mosquito into the paper cup.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2lp7o","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ibga","text":"      ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":2,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":4,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"908vk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"66E98250D74411EC92D1B146CE6884DD","height":235,"id":243320,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hpv4btu2x.jpg","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hpv2btu2x.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hpv3btu2x.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hpvzbtu2x.webp","width":165}},"1":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"6EB5A9F0D74411EC92D1B146CE6884DD","height":160,"id":243324,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hpv8btu2x.jpg","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hpv6btu2x.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hpv7btu2x.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hpv5btu2x.webp","width":265}},"2":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"74727990D74411EC92D1B146CE6884DD","height":272,"id":243328,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hpwcbtu2x.jpg","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hpwabtu2x.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hpwbbtu2x.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hpv9btu2x.webp","width":203}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"q120","text":"Collection cups","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":15}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7l2cj","text":"· Good collection cups may be ones which are paper with a waxy coating on the inside and are strong enough to not crumple when a rubber band is wrapped around them. On these cups you place a layer of mesh (10 cm x 10 cm or fit to size) and this mesh is held in place with a rubber band. Cut a 1 cm hole out of the middle of the mesh and place a cotton ball in this hole to prevent mosquitoes from escaping. All collection cups should be clearly labelled with the details of the sampling effort.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ed4ka","text":"· Keep the collection cups or trap bags organized and protected while in the field. Placing the collection cups or trap bags upright in an airtight container or an insulated cool box. To keep mosquitoes alive and in good condition keep them in a cool place with high humidity and with access to a sugar source (i.e., cotton wool soaked in 10% sugar solution).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"73jb7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"67dj1","text":"    ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":2,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ce6hb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"9AF3CE20D74411EC92D1B146CE6884DD","height":251,"id":243332,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hpwgbtu2x.jpg","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hpwebtu2x.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hpwfbtu2x.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hpwdbtu2x.webp","width":268}},"1":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"A6CC5640D74411EC92D1B146CE6884DD","height":194,"id":243336,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hpwkbtu2x.jpg","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hpwibtu2x.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hpwjbtu2x.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hpwhbtu2x.webp","width":275}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8icse","text":"After the collection of the mosquito samples is completed, the next step is to process the mosquito samples. This may involve killing, sorting and identifying the mosquitoes to species and sex. These processes are outlined below.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c9qj9","text":"Killing adult mosquito samples","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":30}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9m4am","text":"The first step to processing adult mosquito samples usually involves killing or knocking them down (anaesthetizing) by:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6csvt","text":"· Mosquitoes being held in cups or small containers could be placed in a freezer. It will only take a short time for the mosquitoes to die in the freezer. They can be safely left in the freezer for an extended period before they are processed.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2n43a","text":"· A killing cup can be used to knock down the mosquitoes. A cotton ball moistened with ethyl acetate or chloroform could be placed on top of the cup mesh and covered to allow the vapours to concentrate and either knock down or kill the mosquitoes. Wait at least 1 – 2 minutes. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"36dfr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5det","text":"    ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":2,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1fmla","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"7334FB10D74511EC92D1B146CE6884DD","height":163,"id":243340,"is_video":false,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"3r70k","text":"Photo by Nathan Kama, Ministry of Health, Solomon Islands","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hpwqbtu2x.jpg","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hpwnbtu2x.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hpwpbtu2x.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hpwmbtu2x.webp","width":193}},"1":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"76A3E310D74511EC92D1B146CE6884DD","height":210,"id":243344,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hpwubtu2x.jpg","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hpwsbtu2x.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hpwtbtu2x.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hpwrbtu2x.webp","width":249}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3mn7t","text":"Morphological identification","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":28}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7m6h3","text":"Once all specimens are killed, taxonomic identification can occur in the field or back in the laboratory.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dbn8s","text":"· Tip the dead adults from one sampling effort onto a petri dish or paper towel. Ensure you have adequate light to properly see the mosquitoes. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3qlch","text":"· Use a microscope or magnifying glass and a taxonomic key to identify each mosquito. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"567t4","text":"· Record the number of mosquitoes captured by taxonomic species and sex, also if specified by the work plan, record the physiological status (fed, unfed, gravid). Always record zero counts. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6g4ui","text":"Appropriate needs to consider the intended purpose of the samples. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fvdcu","text":"· For sequential molecular analyses, store the samples in small tubes containing enough 70 – 100% ethanol to cover the sample. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"er7k","text":"· If the mosquito morphology needs to be preserved, place the specimens in small tubes with desiccation beads separated by cotton wool. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2fu45","text":"· Note that 1.5 ml specimen tubes can comfortably contain up to 10 samples in ethanol and 5 samples with cotton wool and beads. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8gca3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6bof1","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2bre","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"0CE79970D74611EC92D1B146CE6884DD","height":239,"id":243348,"is_video":false,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"663o9","text":"Photo by Joelyn Goi, Papua New Guinea Institute of Medical Research","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hpwybtu2x.jpg","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hpwwbtu2x.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hpwxbtu2x.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hpwvbtu2x.webp","width":168}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"14uie","text":"It is vital that every tube is clearly and uniquely labelled.The label on each tube should contain the project code, date (DDMMYY), collection time and location. Ensure that sufficient detail is included so that each tube is uniquely labelled.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c15n4","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cb51g","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7lr2p","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"391B3650D74611EC92D1B146CE6884DD","height":159,"id":243352,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hpw4btu2x.jpg","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hpw2btu2x.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hpw3btu2x.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hpwzbtu2x.webp","width":164}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2did","text":"Store the tubes of mosquitoes in white storage boxes to keep the tubes upright. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"96glk","text":"· Uniquely label each box. Write the label on the side and lid of the box. Include the project code in the label. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"456ck","text":"· Record the details of each storage box.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1ou8k","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"71cvp","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6a065","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"5FC2FEA0D74611EC92D1B146CE6884DD","height":130,"id":243356,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hpw8btu2x.jpg","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hpw6btu2x.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hpw7btu2x.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hpw5btu2x.webp","width":187}}}}

title: Mosquito vector surveillance, processing and storage

versions.title: Mosquito vector surveillance, processing and storage
Mosquito vector surveillance, processing and storage
Standard operating procedures for mosquito vector surveillance, processing and storage
versions.title_html: Standard operating procedures for mosquito vector surveillance, processing and storage

warning: {"blocks":[{"key":"2s7rh","text":"Your workplace may require you to complete a risk assessment prior to conducting field work. There are a range of risks to which field workers could be exposed. Below are some examples of concerns for which risk assessments may apply to your situation.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dj0d5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bmkkk","text":"Mosquito transmitted infections","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":31}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e8ers","text":"There is a very small, but real risk of contracting malaria, dengue or other arboviruses from exposure to mosquito bites when conducting field work.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8k00u","text":"When working in the field one must:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":34}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cdmjk","text":"· Within the scope of the work plan, take reasonable steps to minimise exposure to mosquito bites","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aa42r","text":"· If working in a malarious area, provide access to malaria prophylaxis, rapid diagnostics and first-line malaria treatment. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5bd7h","text":"What to do if a collector begins to feel sick:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":46}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7q60i","text":"· In case of illness, the participant should tell the supervisor who will contact the nearest health facility for diagnosis and appropriate health care.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"49of4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"pial","text":"Dog bites","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cj1c","text":"There is a high risk of dog attack when entering a household’s yard. Always talk with the occupant of the household and receive permission before entering the property. Ensure the dog is properly restrained before you enter the property. Ensure you can easily exit the property at all times. Ensure other staff members are aware that there is a dog at the house if they need to visit there.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b13bc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"610o0","text":"Chloroform","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3d814","text":"Chloroform is an anaesthetic and a skin, eye and respiratory tract irritant and is suspected of causing cancer. Chloroform forms vapours and prolonged exposure of several minutes may cause dizziness and nausea. Continued exposure will produce persistent fatigue and headache. A face mask must be worn when handling Chloroform which should only occur in a well-ventilated room. This chemical should not be inhaled and should never be handled by pregnant staff members. Lastly, ensure that there are no open flames in a room where Chloroform is stored or used.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eg8lv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"debq4","text":"Trip hazards","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8oddi","text":"Traps could be a trip hazard for staff and/or occupants. Ensure that the trap is not in a high-traffic location and communicate this potential hazard to occupants before leaving the household.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"96oab","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"emhkp","text":"Battery hazards","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":15}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e7p2a","text":"Ensure that the battery is in proper working condition to avoid any irritations or burns from damaged units. Also ensure the connections are properly secured and power cords in good working condition to avoid any electrical shocks.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
